Warren says she told Harvard, Penn of heritage

Democratic Senate candidate Elizabeth Warren acknowledged she told Harvard and the University of Pennsylvania that she was Native American, but insisted race played no role in her recruitment. (Globe)

GAME 2: Heat 115, C's 111 (OT) > HEAT LEAD 2-0

Rondo gives all, but Celtics lose in OT

Rajon Rondo attacked the basket early to put pressure on the Heat. Rondo, with a career-high 44 points, played all four quarters and the overtime period in the loss. (Getty Images)
Rajon Rondo used his hot hands to sink a jumper in the 2d quarter. He finished 16-24 from the field, making 10-12 free throws and a pair of threes. (Barry Chin / Globe Staff)
Paul Pierce and LeBron James met for their 20th playoff matchup in Game 2. Pierce fouled out near the end of regulation, putting him on the bench for OT. (Getty Images)
Kevin Garnett drove to the basket against Miami's Ronny Turiaf. KG finished with 18 points and 8 rebounds, going 6-6 from the free throw line. (Getty Images)
Paul Pierce and Dwyane Wade both dove for a loose ball in the first quarter, getting tangled up on the floor. (Jim Davis / Globe Staff)
LeBron James celebrated in the second half of Game 2. James led the Heat with 34 points, adding 10 rebounds, 7 assists, and getting to the free throw line 24 times. (Getty)
Kevin Garnett was called for a technical foul after getting tied up with Miami's James Jones under the basket and shoving him away. (Jim Davis / Globe Staff)
Doc Rivers restrained Rajon Rondo as he tried to complain to the officials he was fouled on a crucial layup attempted in overtime. (Barry Chin / Globe Staff)

Equity firm acquiring Talbots for $369m

Hingham-based women's apparel retailer Talbots will be acquired by Sycamore Partners in a $369 million deal, the companies announced today. (Globe, 8:23 a.m.)

Pollen plight plagues Boston, suburbs

Wearing on residents' health and patience, this year's pine pollen is especially intense, a gunky byproduct of a warm winter and a largely dry, windy spring. (Boston Globe)

of oversized sodas

Shootings leave 6 dead in Seattle

A city already anxious about a recent spate of shootings was rattled further when a man walked into an arts cafe and opened fire, fatally wounding four. Police say he later killed a woman during a carjacking before shooting himself.
